meanings.definition: Not able to be sold or marketed.
meanings.sent1: The damaged goods were unmarketable due to their poor condition.
meanings.sent2: The outdated technology became unmarketable as newer models were released.
meanings.sent3: The idea of selling ice to polar bears would be unmarketable.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for singing was unmarketable in a world of tone-deaf listeners.
meanings.sent5: The moldy bread was so unmarketable that even the pigeons refused to eat it.

meanings.definition: Not appealing or desirable to buyers.
meanings.sent1: The bland color palette made the painting unmarketable to art collectors.
meanings.sent2: The smelly cheese was unmarketable to customers looking for fresh produce.
meanings.sent3: Trying to sell a broken umbrella during a drought would be unmarketable.
meanings.sent4: Her unmarketable sense of humor left her without any friends.
meanings.sent5: The scratched furniture was so unmarketable that even thrift stores refused to take it.
